meanings.definition: Capable of being drawn back or in
meanings.sent1: The retractile claws of the cat helped it catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The retractile antenna of the snail disappeared into its shell.
meanings.sent3: The retractile straw surprised the child as it magically shrank back into itself.
meanings.sent4: Her retractile smile hid her true feelings from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The retractile curtains allowed just the right amount of sunlight into the room.

meanings.definition: Able to be retracted or withdrawn
meanings.sent1: The retractile ladder folded neatly against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The retractile leash made it easy to control the dog's movements.
meanings.sent3: The retractile pen amused the students as it clicked back into place.
meanings.sent4: His retractile excuses always seemed to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The retractile wheels on the suitcase made it effortless to transport.
